post_text: As May comes to an end, the anticipation and excitement for June begins to build. June will be filled with many virtual opportunities to celebrate our students. This week’s message from Dr. Farrell celebrates the resiliency and commitment of our STUDENTS! The ability of an entire learning community to successfully transition academically, socially and emotionally, from a “brick-n-mortar” setting to a virtual learning platform is the direct result of teamwork between students, staff, and parents. We hope you will take a moment to view Dr. Farrell’s message here: https://youtu.be/mlac3kSpZSM www.brickschools.org
.
Have a good weekend!
Stay Safe & Well

post_text:
Good Evening, Please will take a moment to listen to Dr. Farrell's weekly message at www.brickschools.org. Spring Recess will take place from April 10th through April 17th. Visit the district website for “Spring Staycation” menu of activities…filled with family fun ideas. Send us pictures of your family engaging in one or more of the activities to schoolspirit@brickschools.org. Submissions will be used to create a video of our community enjoying family time over break.
Please take the time over this break to reflect, recharge, and re-energize. We hope you will stay connected and informed through the district website at www.brickschools.org. We look forward to seeing you all again in our Virtual Learning Platform on Monday, April 20th.
Stay safe and well and enjoy the break.

post_text:
SCHOOL CLOSURE CONTINUATION ANNOUNCEMENT
In accordance with the Governor’s Executive Order 104 that all New Jersey schools will be closed, the Brick Township School District will remain closed (inclusive of Spring Recess) until such time as it is deemed safe to reopen by health officials. We are constantly monitoring this situation with the NJ State Department of Education and the Governor’s Office. Additionally, as our “Remote Learning Plan” continues to evolve, we will provide updates regarding the next phase of our instructional plans via our website.
text:
SCHOOL CLOSURE CONTINUATION ANNOUNCEMENT
In accordance with the Governor’s Executive Order 104 that all New Jersey schools will be closed, the Brick Township School District will remain closed (inclusive of Spring Recess) until such time as it is deemed safe to reopen by health officials. We are constantly monitoring this situation with the NJ State Department of Education and the Governor’s Office. Additionally, as our “Remote Learning Plan” continues to evolve, we will provide updates regarding the next phase of our instructional plans via our website.

post_text: Thank you to the students and parents for working with all of our teachers, administrators and district staff as we navigate this time of uncertainty together. As we all work to successfully interact with the Brick Township Public Schools Remote Learning Plan it is key that we continue to communicate. As such we hope that each family will take a moment to listen to an important message from Dr. Farrell, Superintendent of Schools, and Dr. Anderson, Director of Curriculum and Instruction. Their message can be viewed on the BTPS website at: www.brickschools.org

As we all work to successfully interact with the Brick Township Public Schools Remote Learning Plan it is key that we continue to communicate. As such we hope that each family will take a moment to listen to an important message from Dr. Farrell, Superintendent of Schools, and Dr. Anderson, Director of Curriculum and Instruction. Their message can be viewed on the BTPS website at: www.brickschools.org

post_text:
The Brick Township Public School District is dedicated to the continuity of instruction when schools need to be closed for an extended period of time. In response to the conditions surrounding the rapidly evolving COVID-19 outbreak, we have initiated the Brick Township Public Schools Remote Learning Plan starting March 16, 2020. Our Remote Learning Plan will enable us to provide home instruction for all enrolled students during a public health-related school closure. As such, these instructional days will count towards the 180 day requirement in accordance with N.J.S.A. 18A: 7F-9.

Please connect to our District website to access the Remote Learning Plan and FAQs: www.brickschools.org
text:
The Brick Township Public School District is dedicated to the continuity of instruction when schools need to be closed for an extended period of time. In response to the conditions surrounding the rapidly evolving COVID-19 outbreak, we have initiated the Brick Township Public Schools Remote Learning Plan starting March 16, 2020. Our Remote Learning Plan will enable us to provide home instruction for all enrolled students during a public health-related school closure. As such, these instructional days will count towards the 180 day requirement in accordance with N.J.S.A. 18A: 7F-9.

Please connect to our District website to access the Remote Learning Plan and FAQs: www.brickschools.org

post_text:
Given the Governor’s message on the inevitability of directed school closings, and after consultation with the Executive County Superintendent as well as the Ocean County Health Department on the increased activity of the Coronavirus; we will be closing schools Monday, March 16th and anticipate being closed through Friday, March 27th.

However, we will evaluate weekly and update all accordingly. We will be implementing our home instruction remote learning preparedness plan in an effort to be proactive in combating the spread of this virus. This plan will go into effect Monday, March 16th and will remain in place until school reopens.

Further information regarding the remote learning plan will be made available to parents via Blackboard and the District website by Monday, March 16th.

For more information: https://www.brickschools.org/Portals/0/Content/District/COVID/Coronavirus%20Parent%20Letter%20for%20School%20Closure.pdf

Dr. Thomas G. Farrell, Superintendent of Schools
text:
Given the Governor’s message on the inevitability of directed school closings, and after consultation with the Executive County Superintendent as well as the Ocean County Health Department on the increased activity of the Coronavirus; we will be closing schools Monday, March 16th and anticipate being closed through Friday, March 27th.

However, we will evaluate weekly and update all accordingly. We will be implementing our home instruction remote learning preparedness plan in an effort to be proactive in combating the spread of this virus. This plan will go into effect Monday, March 16th and will remain in place until school reopens.

Further information regarding the remote learning plan will be made available to parents via Blackboard and the District website by Monday, March 16th.

For more information: https://www.brickschools.org/Portals/0/Content/District/COVID/Coronavirus%20Parent%20Letter%20for%20School%20Closure.pdf

Dr. Thomas G. Farrell, Superintendent of Schools

post_text:
Good Evening Parents/Guardians/& Community Members
A letter from the Brick Township Public Schools Superintendent, Dr. Thomas Farrell has been posted on the district website. The Brick Township Public Schools believes that communication is important to address concerns and cease rumors; this communique provides clarity that we have developed a plan and are in constant contact with the NJDOE and the NJDOH as we monitor and assess the changing conditions. We have clear guidelines from the NJDOE, as well as the CDC, and any updates and advisement will be forthcoming through Blackboard directing you to check the District website. We have been adhering to stringent disinfectant cleaning protocols throughout the District; this weekend we will increase the level of the stringent disinfectant cleaning in each of our schools. Moving forward, if implementation of the home instruction through the remote learning plan is necessary, we will work together to ensure access and equity for continued instruction for all learners.

http://www.brickschools.org/COVID-19#0312
shared_text:
BRICKSCHOOLS.ORG
Brick Township Board of Education > COVID-19
text:
Good Evening Parents/Guardians/& Community Members
A letter from the Brick Township Public Schools Superintendent, Dr. Thomas Farrell has been posted on the district website. The Brick Township Public Schools believes that communication is important to address concerns and cease rumors; this communique provides clarity that we have developed a plan and are in constant contact with the NJDOE and the NJDOH as we monitor and assess the changing conditions. We have clear guidelines from the NJDOE, as well as the CDC, and any updates and advisement will be forthcoming through Blackboard directing you to check the District website. We have been adhering to stringent disinfectant cleaning protocols throughout the District; this weekend we will increase the level of the stringent disinfectant cleaning in each of our schools. Moving forward, if implementation of the home instruction through the remote learning plan is necessary, we will work together to ensure access and equity for continued instruction for all learners.

http://www.brickschools.org/COVID-19#0312
